title: Satellite images show Russia’s troop movements but can they reveal intent?
summary: Commercial spy satellites provides extraordinary intelligence about Russian troop advances in Ukraine and attacks on Ukrainian cities. But as the conflict grinds on, intelligence analysts at times are still being challenged to figure out Russian intent.

title: Skycorp to test “USB for space” cable outside ISS
summary: Skycorp Inc., a California company focused on orbital logistics, is preparing to test a key component of future satellite servicing vehicles on the International Space Station.

title: Russia issues ultimatum to UK government over OneWeb launch
summary: Russia’s space agency said Wednesday it will not launch a batch of 36 OneWeb satellites this week unless the UK government gives up its stake in the satellite internet company, a prospect the UK business secretary later confirmed won’t happen.

title: Moon impact: Chinese rocket stage still in space says U.S. Space Command
summary: A spent rocket upper stage from China’s 2014 Chang’e-5 T1 mission thought set to impact the moon did not reenter the atmosphere as previously stated, according to U.S. Space Command.

title: Atlas 5 rocket aces another on-target launch with NOAA weather satellite
summary: A United Launch Alliance Atlas 5 rocket lifted off from Cape Canaveral and delivered the GOES-T weather satellite into orbit Tuesday, adding a new spacecraft to NOAA’s fleet destined to become the primary observatory tracking storms over the Pacific Ocean and the Western United States.

title: Rogozin puts poison-pill conditions on OneWeb Soyuz launch
summary: This week’s Soyuz launch of a set of OneWeb satellites has been thrown into doubt after Russia made new demands on the company.

title: Russia places extraordinary demands on OneWeb prior to satellite launch
summary: Cooperation in space among Russia and the West has been stripped to the bone.

title: Russian sanctions throw South Korean satellite missions into uncertainty
summary: South Korea, at least for now, is pushing forward with its planned launch of two satellites on Russian rockets this year. Still, it doesn’t rule out the possibility that the missions could be delayed due to sanctions imposed on Russia for invading Ukraine.

title: CesiumAstro raises $60 million in Series B funding round
summary: CesiumAstro Inc. raised $60 million in a Series B funding round led by Airbus Ventures and Forever Ventures.

title: Romania signs the Artemis Accords
summary: Romania became the 16th country to sign the NASA-led Artemis Accords for cooperation in space exploration March 1.
